pullRequest.body:
Shows that IsCycles is appropriately named. The core result is `IsCycles.exists_cycle_toSubgraph_verts_eq_connectedComponent_supp`, which shows that for an edge in a nontrivial component a cycle can be constructed that has exactly the edges of the component.

In order to get this some API is included:

- Coercions of walks in graphs that are the result of coerced subgraphs
- NeighborSets of `toSubgraph` for paths
- Supporting results for `IsCycles`
- Some miscellaneous supporting lemma's

This is all in preparation for Tutte's theorem. 

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

</details>

Is that not `p.map someGraphEmbeddingHere`?
:man_facepalming: (It is in fact `Subgraph.hom`, so that saves a lot of code:D)
Was this not in the previous PR already? Maybe you forgot to merge master?
This is the variant for paths, the last one was for cycles. I'm not sure I overlooked something in combining those, but I don't see a way to combine those.

```suggestion

```
and everywhere else
I think I got all of them (I didn't realize that they are not needed to match in rintro/rcases, those were most of them:))

```suggestion

```


```suggestion
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Connectivity.Subgraph
```

```suggestion
lemma spanningCoe_subgraphOfAdj {v w : V} (hadj : G.Adj v w) :

```


Can't you get away with a much weaker assumption than `h`? Something like
```suggestion
    (hc : H.Connected) (h : G â‰¤ H.spanningCoe) :
    âˆƒ c : G.ConnectedComponent, H.verts = c.supp := by
```

I changed this to be an implication, rather than an iff. Your suggestion implices that `H = âŠ¤`, so I don't think that's weaker. I can't see a more compact way to write this down due to the asymmetry between v being in H.verts and w not necessarily being, I also added a comment to stress this part:)
Oh, right!


```suggestion
    (hcyc : G.IsCycles) (p : G.Walk v w) (hw : w â‰  w') (hw' : w' âˆˆ p.support) (hp : p.IsPath)
    (hadj : G.Adj v w') : p.snd = w' := by
```



```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨w', âŸ¨hw'1, hw'2âŸ©, hwuâŸ© := hcyc.existsUnique_ne_adj
    (p.toSubgraph_adj_snd hpn).adj_sub
```

```suggestion
        refine (Set.nonempty_of_ncard_ne_zero ?_).mono (p.toSubgraph.neighborSet_subset v)
        rw [hp.1.ncard_neighborSet_toSubgraph_eq_two hv]
        omega
```
maybe?

The `[DecidableEq V]` instance is only necessary for the proof and not the statement so you can drop it from the statement and just add `classical` into the proof.

Also `[Fintype V]` tell us _how_ `V`is finite (this is data) but here you only need to know _that_ `V` is finite (a proposition) so we can use `[Finite V]` instead. The advantage is that you will avoid decidability diamonds (there are multiple ways for how something can be finite).
```suggestion
lemma IsCycles.snd_of_mem_support_of_isPath_of_adj [Finite V] {v w w' : V}
```
(and just add `classical` into the proof)

Again we have a better lemma if we just assume `Finite V`. However in this case because you're using the builtin `termination_by` techniques you will actually need a version assuming `Fintype V` from which you can deduce the superior `Finite V` version. I therefore suggest:
```suggestion
lemma IsCycles.reachable_sdiff_toSubgraph_spanningCoe_aux [Fintype V] {v w : V}
```
and then adding second lemma below stating:
```lean
lemma IsCycles.reachable_sdiff_toSubgraph_spanningCoe [Finite V] {v w : V}
    (hcyc : G.IsCycles) (p : G.Walk v w) (hp : p.IsPath) :
    (G \ p.toSubgraph.spanningCoe).Reachable w v := by
  have : Fintype V := Fintype.ofFinite V
  exact reachable_sdiff_toSubgraph_spanningCoe_aux hcyc p hp
```
and make the auxiliary one `private`!

```suggestion
lemma IsCycles.reachable_deleteEdges [Finite V] (hadj : G.Adj v w)
```

```suggestion
lemma IsCycles.exists_cycle_toSubgraph_verts_eq_connectedComponentSupp [Finite V]
```
and I think you'll then need `classical` in the proof.
No action required for now but I think worth considering naming this property of `Subgraph`s + building a little API in future work.
No action required but often a lemma which consumes a natural number together with a hypothesis that it is non-zero, is better stated in terms of its successor.
Really? `n` + `n \ne 0` is more syntactically general than `n + 1`. We've done the opposite change to what you're suggesting many times
Yes, I'm aware. It just depends on the situation.
Kept it as-is for now, but I'll keep it in mind for the future/refactoring if the other option turns out to be more useful.

```suggestion
lemma adj_iff_of_neighborSet_equiv {v : V} {H : Subgraph G}
```
and add `classical` to the proof
